resources.string: Grigore Antipa National Museum of Natural History
It is the seat of the Parliament of Romania, the largest administrative building in the world and known for its ornate interior composed of 23 sections and three museums.
A famous place in the old historical center of Bucharest, build at the beginning of 19th century, by the nobleman Manuc Bei.

It is one of the most notable landmarks of the capital and it can be deemed a symbol of Bucharest. The structure of the current Triumphal Arch dates back to 1922 and later in 1938 in its final form, was inaugurated.

Constructed from 1888–1893 at the behest of Romania\'s first king, Carol I, Cotroceni Palace has since 1991 been the official residence of the Romanian President. Part of the palace is open to the public, and can be visited on a tour.
Art and traditions blend together in a beautiful neo-romanian building that takes you back in a time when all was pure and simple.
One of the most precious collections of osteology, zoology, mineralogy, geology, paleontology will enchant your eyes and your mind.

From prehistoric times up to modern times, you will encounter beautiful artifacts with unique stories. Build in an eclectic style, the museum houses also the Romanian Jewl Crown, a replic of Trajan\’s Column and Pietroasele treasure.
An place that is waiting for you with wonderful concerts of classical music.
Entertain oneself watching plays from universal literature.
A combination of old and new that is famous for the night life.
A place full of beautiful vegetation, known for it\'s wide variety of trees and shrubs and also for floral cherries from the japanese garden donated by the emperor of Japan.
A beautiful green scenery that houses the oldest public garden in Bucharest.
A perfect place for a ride with your or a rented bike around the lake.
